name: Grilled Teriyaki Prawns with Asparagus and Coconut Rice
author: Julie Hubert
summary: Teriyaki prawns and asparagus are grilled and served on a bed of coconut jasmine rice for a quick and easy, Asian-inspired barbeque dish.
ingredients: 1 ¼ pounds large white prawns, peeled and deveined
½ cup teriyaki sauce (such as Mr. Yoshida's®)
freshly ground black pepper to taste
2 tablespoons teriyaki sauce (such as Mr. Yoshida's®)
directions: Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat and lightly oil the grate
Rinse rice in cold water until water runs clear
Drain and combine with coconut milk, water, and 1 teaspoon salt in a pot and bring to a boil over high heat
Cover; reduce heat to low and simmer until tender, about 12 minutes
Mix prawns and 1/2 cup teriyaki sauce together in a bowl until well coated
Toss asparagus with remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt, sesame oil, and black pepper
Lay on 1 side of the grill; cook until tender, about 3 minutes
Add prawns to the other side of the grill
Grill shrimp until opaque and asparagus is lightly browned, 3 to 4 minutes more
Sprinkle scallions and sesame seeds on top
Drizzle 2 tablespoons teriyaki sauce on top
